Package com.langtonsant

Class Solution

java.lang.Object
com.langtonsant.Solution
public class Solution
extends java.lang.Object
Simulates Langton's Ant with the provided parameters in the main function.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private static class  Solution.Ant
    Represents the ant on the grid.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

    • computeLangtonsAntGrid

      public static char[][] computeLangtonsAntGrid​(int rows, int cols, int antRow, int antCol, char directionChar, int steps)
      This function will compute the simulate Langton's ant with the requested parameters and will return the final state of the grid after the ant has taken all its requested steps.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the grid.
      cols - The number of columns in the grid.
      antRow - The initial ant row (zero-indexed).
      antCol - The initial ant column (zero-indexed).
      directionChar - The initial ant direction represented as a char.
      steps - The number of steps the ant will take in the grid.
      Returns:
      The grid containing the final state of the Langton's Ant simulation where '.' represents white and '#' represents black.

    • computeDirectionFromChar

      private static int computeDirectionFromChar​(char directionChar)
      The character is converted to an integer to make it easy to add or subtract 90 degrees, since each 90 degree change can be represented by incrementing or decrementing the integer by 1 (modulo 4).
      Parameters:
      directionChar - The direction represented as a char ('^', '>', 'v', '<').
      Returns:
      The char direction converted to an integer representation (0, 1, 2, 3).

    • constructInitialGrid

      private static char[][] constructInitialGrid​(int rows, int cols)
      Create a grid of the requested size with all cells initialized to white ('.') and no cells black ('#').
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the grid.
      cols - The number of columns in the grid.
      Returns:
      The initial grid.

    • updateLangtonsGridForAntMovement

      private static void updateLangtonsGridForAntMovement​(char[][] grid, Solution.Ant ant)
      Update the provided grid after the ant takes a step.
      Parameters:
      grid - The grid that will be updated.
      ant - The object containing the information for the ant (i.e. its location and direction).

    • moveAntOneStepInDirection

      private static void moveAntOneStepInDirection​(Solution.Ant ant, int direction, int rows, int cols)
      Move the ant one step in the provided direction.
      Parameters:
      ant - The ant which will be moved.
      direction - The direction to move the ant.
      rows - The total number of rows in the grid.
      cols - The total number of cols in the grid.

    • printGrid

      private static void printGrid​(char[][] grid)
      Prints the provided grid to the system.
      Parameters:
      grid - The grid to be printed.

    • drawAntOnGrid

      private static char[][] drawAntOnGrid​(char[][] grid, Solution.Ant ant)
      Place the ant onto the grid with its current direction for display. A copy of the provided grid is made and returned.
      Parameters:
      grid - The grid on which to draw the ant location.
      ant - The ant that will be drawn onto the grid.
      Returns:
      The copy of the grid with the ant placed on it.
